Technically, the devaluation of the dollar is why the price of gas is going up.Â In comparative value, Gasoline is cheaper today than it was 50 years ago.
50 years ago, in 1962, you could buy a gallon of gas for a quarter.Â A 90% silver quarter.
Today on the Spot market, that same 1962 quarter is worth $5.80 cents.
Gas is cheaper today than 50 years ago.Â Just like a PC is cheaper today than 10 or 20 years ago.Â
Prices go up, but price is not value.Â It is the indicator of the decline of value.
